Darkhawk/Perceptor:

"Do it"said Darkhawk full in pain "Please i want this pain is over..."

Perceptor shock his head and said "Sometimes reprogramation process is 
failure... Pity!!! The big mistake of Hydras was left a so good warrior 
behind... Something that Megatron, the old MEgatron havent done"

"You speaks as if you have met him"replied Darkhawk

"I've been fuctioning long a go before Orion Pax also know as Optimus 
Prime"said Dryly.

"What now Autobot"said Perceptor rudely to Tucson"I want to leave this place 
as much as you, and it isnt good for my reputation been seen chatting with 
you; shall we leave this place now or not? I dont need your map, I know 
every single rock in this place... So are we leaving or not?"


--------------------------------------------------
From: "Sandy" <magicquartz@...>
Sent: Friday, April 30, 2010 10:20 PM
To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
Subject: Re: The Light of the Flame!

> Night Shift carefully scans Darkhawk's body for damages, with very gentile 
> hands along each limb.  He remains calm through the ordeal of being stuck 
> down a hole and then replies to Perceptor.
>
> "Look, I don't care who's on who's side right now, thing is, were here and 
> we gotta work tagether. No if's and's or buts.  All I know is that 
> Darkhawk's hurt and I wanna find out how serious his injuries are. And 
> Tucson Prime wants ta know the same thing.  Ya see, that's who we are, we 
> look out for each other, and sometimes even our enemies."
>
> Tucson Prime could still hear echoes resounding in the dark ditch, and he 
> uses his sharp hearing to try and listen for a way out.  He concentrates 
> on any slight sound he may be able to pick up.  Then, his sense of touch 
> quickly sharpens, as he feels the hot breezes of the lava pit touch his 
> hand as he felt for breezes through his fingers.  He could also hear 
> Rodimus getting a bit frustrated.  He couldn't blame him.  It was quite 
> the tribulation of dealing with a blind comrade who is at the present time 
> without his finest of sonar gear.
>
> "It's all right Rodimus, I understand this is hard for you.  We never 
> really know how lucky we are, until something very vital to our survival 
> is taken away from us.  We will get out of here, and when we do, I promise 
> to have extensive repairs on my optic sensors and visual components which 
> will indeed be permanent.  Perhaps what is done for me, could also be done 
> for Perceptor.  That's if, Perceptor, you wish to come with us.  I don't 
> need my eyes to understand what has happened to all of you who serve 
> Hydras. I see a lot of talent among all of you, a talent he fails to see, 
> and acknowledge with compassion.  I think this may have happened for a 
> reason."
>
> He directs his attentions to Dark Hawk first.
>
> "Darkhawk, your tactical skills as a warrior are exceptional. I'm rather 
> impressed with the way you nearly saw me for scrap.  Talents like that 
> need to be appreciated and if you were to work with me, I'd deeply 
> appreciate them."
>
> He then directs his attentions to Perceptor.
>
> "Perceptor, your understanding of intel is also highly impressive.  You'd 
> be a great asset to me and in return for your exceptional skills, I'd 
> offer you anything you think you may need or want.  And if it's freedom 
> you desire, then that I will gladly give you. You see, everyone, Rodimus, 
> Night Shift, Perceptor, Darkhawk, we may be on different factions but we 
> were made from the same creator.  Are we really that different from each 
> other?  I don't think so."
>
> Tucson Prime could now see the situation as a whole even though right now 
> he was blind.  Perceptor and Darkhawk served Hydras, an evil power hungry 
> leader who wanted nothing but domination and destruction. And if anyone 
> dared to fail in their duties, he'd shove them asside, as he had done with 
> Perceptor and Dark Hawk.  He felt sorry for them, and it panged at his 
> heart spark to know that Hydras could be so cruel to them.  And for the 
> first time, sensing Dark Hawk near him, he puts a gentile hand on his 
> shoulder, rather than a clenching painful fist around it.
>
> "What ever side you chose, it's your choice.  We will not be angry with 
> what you chose.  Freedom is the right of all Sentient beings.  And I sense 
> this is what you and Perceptor long for.  I am giving you what you are 
> entitled to. Now, I sense a hot breeze but then, there's also a down draft 
> that seems a bit temperate.  I'm getting a fix on that down draft and I'm 
> going to see if I can map it out internally and try to get a map grid over 
> to Rodimus and Night Shift.  If you want, Perceptor, I can give you this 
> grid also, but you have to allow me to do it."
>
> He kneels down beside Dark Hawk.
>
> " It's all right, since you're injured, I'll carry you with me, if you'll 
> let me."
>
